'''Adrahil''' was the twenty-first [[Princes of Dol Amroth|Prince of Dol Amroth]].<ref name=DolAmroth>{{PM|Elendil}}, ''The Line of Dol Amroth'', p. 223</ref>

==History==
Adrahil was the son of [[Angelimir]]. He became the twenty-first Prince of Dol Amroth after his father's death in {{TA|2977}}.<ref name=DolAmroth/>

Adrahil had three children. His oldest daughter, [[Ivriniel]], his second daughter, [[Finduilas (wife of Denethor)|Finduilas]] and his youngest child and only son, [[Imrahil]].<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}, genealogical table, p. 221</ref>

In {{TA|2976}}<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2976, p. 1089</ref> Adrahil's daughter Finduilas married [[Denethor]], the son of [[Steward of Gondor|Steward]] [[Ecthelion II]] of [[Gondor]].<ref>{{App|Stewards}}, entries for Steward Ecthelion II and Steward Denethor II, pp. 1055-56</ref>

Two years later in {{TA|2978}} Finduilas' older son [[Boromir]] was born and five years after that in {{TA|2983}} her younger son [[Faramir]] was born.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entries for the years 2978 and 2983, p. 1089</ref>

Five years after the birth of her second son Faramir, Finduilas died young at the age of 38 in {{TA|2988}}.<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2988, p. 1089</ref>

Adrahil died in {{TA|3010}} and was succeeded by his only son Imrahil.<ref name=DolAmroth/>

==Etymology==
Adrahil presumably is an [[Adûnaic]] name<ref>, manuscript F2, §9 footnote concerning names in Quenya</ref> of unknown meaning. 

The second element ''-hil'' (also seen in the name ''[[Imrahil]]'') perhaps is related to the [[Westron]] ending ''-kil'' (cf. ''[[banakil]], [[Tarkil]]'') meaning "man", ultimately related to [[Elvish]] "follower".<ref>[[Carl F. Hostetter]], [[Patrick Wynne]], "An Adunaic Dictionary", published in ''[[Vinyar Tengwar 25]]'' (September [[1992]]), pp. 16-17</ref>
